sbml.test
Class SBMLTestCase

java.lang.Object
  sbml.test.SBMLTestCase

public class SBMLTestCase
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains most of the logic for the testing included in the SBML Test Suite.

public java.lang.String getSbmlTestdir()
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       java.io.FileNotFoundException
Gets the test case directory

Returns:
A string containing the path to the test case directory - Used in web application only
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the config file cannot be opened
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the config file cannot be found

readResults

public java.math.BigDecimal[][] readResults(java.lang.String filename,
                                            int header,
                                            int steps,
                                            int variables_count)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                            java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                            java.lang.Exception
Reads the results of a test case result file into a two dimensional bigdecimal array

Parameters:
filename - filename to read
header - 1 or 0 indicates the presence of a header - at this time it is always set to 1 expecting all files to have a header
steps - the number of steps as given in the settings file
variables_count - the number of variables as giving in the settings file
Returns:
a 2D BigDecimal array of results.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.lang.NumberFormatException
java.lang.Exception - returns an exception if the file does not have the indicated number of variables as read from the settings fiel

validateResults

public void validateResults(java.math.BigDecimal[][] resultdata,
                            java.math.BigDecimal[][] userresultdata)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Makes sure the user result file has the same number of timesteps etc as defined in the settings file

Parameters:
resultdata - control result multidimensional array
userresultdata - user result multidimensional array
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - throws an exception if there are an inconsistant number of rows between the two input files and if the time step values do not match up

compareResults

public java.math.BigDecimal[][] compareResults(java.math.BigDecimal[][] resultdata,
                                               java.math.BigDecimal[][] inputdata,
                                               int steps,
                                               int variables_count)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
Subtracts the corresponding fields to give the difference between the values in the user and control result files

Parameters:
resultdata - control result data multidimensional array
inputdata - user result data multidimensional array
steps - the number of steps in the test
variables_count - the number of variables in the test
Returns:
returns a multidimensional array containing the differences of the compared files.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the files are of different lengths it returns an exception

analyzeResults

public int analyzeResults(java.math.BigDecimal[][] control,
                          java.math.BigDecimal[][] differences,
                          int variables,
                          java.math.BigDecimal absolute,
                          java.math.BigDecimal relative)
Looks at the allowable difference and how it compares to the differences of the user and control files

Parameters:
control - control file results multidimensional array
differences - differences mulitdimensional array (from the compareResults function)
variables - number of variables
absolute - the absolute allowable difference from the settings file
relative - the relative allowable difference from the settings file
Returns:
and integer - the number of failed comparisons in the file - if equal to zero then the test passed.

readSettingsFile

public void readSettingsFile(java.lang.String filename)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.io.FileNotFoundException
Reads the values in the settings file

Parameters:
filename - path to the settings file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if the settings file cannot be opened.
java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown if the settings file cannot be found.

getUsertestlist

public java.util.Map getUsertestlist(java.lang.String dirname)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Gets the user test file directory and checks the format of the files in the directory - only used in web version of test suite.

Parameters:
dirname - path to the test case directory
Returns:
a hashmap of the testname and user result file name
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the user test file has an incorrect name format.

deleteDirectory

public boolean deleteDirectory(java.io.File path)
Deletes a directory containing uploaded test cases.

Parameters:
path - path to test case files
Returns:
boolean value indicating success of deletion.
